title: Imagine Cup Student Training Post-Quiz
complete: Congratulations! You have completed and passed the Imagine Cup Post-Training Quiz. You are now able to participate in the live monthly mentoring webinars that are being hosted by Microsoft Full Time Employees from October 2021 - January 2022. Click on each of the links below to add each of those live webinars to your calendar.

quiz.questionText: As defined in this training, what is a 'wave?'

answerOptions.answerText: A metaphor for an industry trend on the horizon
An idea that has been attempted before
A prediction that a specific company's future revenues will quickly rise.

quiz.questionText: What anniversary is the Imagine Cup Competition celebrating during the 2021-2022 season?
Which team won the Imagine Cup Competition during the 2020-2021 Season?
Which of the following tools could you use to meet with your team over video?
Research has shown the ____ teams are more likely to perform better.
Which of the following questions is best to answer before you get started on building, designing, or coding your project?

answerOptions.answerText: How many people should I hire when this becomes big?
What problem does it solve? Who does it help? Why is it important?

quiz.questionText: Chloe is creating an app that connects Teachers needing school supplies with folks in their local community that have excess supplies. Of the options below, who would you recommend Chloe talk to about their app?

answerOptions.answerText: Chloe's Best friend from college, who is now an architect
Chloe's favorite cousin, who is an engineer

quiz.questionText: _________ testing is when you test that larger parts of your prototype work together
Jen is looking to figure out if her app's architecture is reasonable. What type of review should Jen conduct?

answerOptions.answerText: A benefit that gives students access to their Azure subscription for up to 1 year and allows them to spend up to $100 on Azure services.
A teaching platform that allows teachers to test students on their knowledge of Azure.
A service that helps students prepare for technical interviews.

quiz.questionText: In the Azure Portal, what does the 'Azure Monitor' allow you to do?

answerOptions.answerText: Track how many people are talking about your app on social media
Monitor your apps and infrastructure's resources costs.
Gauge how popular your app is on the app store.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following is a 'a progressive web framework allowing developers to get up and running quickly'
As defined in this training, what is a pitch?

answerOptions.answerText: A short presentation that describes your project, who it helps, and what problem is solves.
A commercial where companies try to get regular people to work at their company.
When a company founder tells their employees that the company is being acquired.

quiz.questionText: What are 2 important details to understand when deciding to scale your project?

answerOptions.answerText: What should our startup office color be? Should our company allow pets?
When can we hire interns? What projects should we give interns?
Who is going to benefit from it? How are they going to use it?

quiz.questionText: When scaling your project, ethics is a consideration that you and your team should make. Which of the following is an unethical practice when scaling?

answerOptions.answerText: Not updating customers on the outcome of company meetings.
Not letting customers know your company product roadmap.
Not disclosing to customers how their data is used.
